titleStmt.title: J. F. Stewart et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10524

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
May 21' 1861
Louisa Lawrance Co. Ky.
To His Excellency. Bariah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky,
The Subscribers would respectfly Solicit your Excelency to releace our fellow citizen James Marcum of a fine of ten dollars this day found against him for one act of retailing Spirits.
Judgment rendered before A Short J, L, C

J. F Stewart Atty.
John H Allison Shereff
W Ratliff
J. B.. Mainard
F. R. Moore
William Chapman
John. W. Keller one of the Jury
Armsted Burchett
G C Leash
M B Goble
S. S Billups
H Meek
Owen Thommson
Jesse Meek
S Short Judge ^of county &^ quarterly Crt
Tho Wallace
Charles Wilson
J W Haws S L C
S J Yates
